summary: If your bank failed, what would happen to the money in your checking or savings account? The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation protects your money if an FDIC-insured bank fails—up to $250,000 per individual depositor. It insures more than $7 trillion in deposits. We audit the financial statements of FDIC's insurance funds each year and issue an opinion on them, as well as on the effectiveness...
title: Financial Audit: Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Funds’ 2019 and 2018 Financial Statements
